metadata.title: CVE-2021-37990 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate implementation in WebView in Google Chrome on Android priorto 95.0.4638.54 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via acrafted app.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37990` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '95.0.4638.69-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
